questionTitle: _________ model consists of the particular types of services that you can access on a cloud computing platform.
questionExplanation: Service models describe the type of service that the service provider is offering.

questionOption1: The use of the word “cloud” makes reference to the two essential concepts
questionOption2: Cloud computing abstracts systems by pooling and sharing resources
questionOption3: cloud computing is nothing more than the Internet
questionExplanation: Abstraction and Virtualization are the two essential concepts.

questionTitle: ________ refers to the location and management of the cloud’s infrastructure.
questionExplanation: The deployment model tells you where the cloud is located and for what purpose.

questionTitle: Which of the following is the deployment model?
questionExplanation: Public, private, community, and hybrid clouds are deployment models.

questionOption1: Cloud Computing has two distinct sets of models
questionOption2: Amazon has built a worldwide network of datacenters to service its search engine
questionOption3: Azure enables .NET Framework applications to run over the Internet
questionExplanation: Google has built mega data centres for its search engine.

questionTitle: Which of the following is best known service model?
questionExplanation: The best-known service models are Software as a Service, Platform as a Service, and Infrastructure as a Service—the SPI model.

questionTitle: The __________ model originally did not require a cloud to use virtualization to pool resources.
questionExplanation: NIST stands for National Institute of Standards and Technology.

questionTitle: _______ model attempts to categorize a cloud network based on four dimensional factors.
questionExplanation: Cloud Cube model is mainly used for secure collaboration.

questionTitle: How many types of dimensions exists in Cloud Cube Model?
questionExplanation: There are four types of dimensions in Cloud Cube.

questionTitle: Which of the following dimension is related to organization’s boundaries?
questionExplanation: Internal (I) / External (E) determines your organization’s boundaries.
